# The `SelectionDAG` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

This is used to represent a portion of an LLVM function in a low-level Data <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dependence">Dependence</a> DAG representation suitable for instruction selection. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Declaration

<CodeBlock>class llvm::SelectionDAG</CodeBlock>

## Description {#details}

This is used to represent a portion of an LLVM function in a low-level Data <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dependence">Dependence</a> DAG representation suitable for instruction selection.

This DAG is constructed as the first step of instruction selection in order to allow implementation of machine specific optimizations and code simplifications.

The representation used by the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/selectiondag">SelectionDAG</a> is a target-independent representation, which has some similarities to the GCC RTL representation, but is significantly more simple, powerful, and is a graph form instead of a linear form.

Definition at line 228 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/selectiondag-h">SelectionDAG.h</a>.

### getConstantFP() {#a354aae224911d4dab66e34bfa10cf5d6}

<MemberDefinition

Create a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantfpsdnode">ConstantFPSDNode</a> wrapping a constant value.

If VT is a vector type, the constant is splatted into a BUILD&#95;VECTOR.

If only legal types can be produced, this does the necessary transformations (e.g., if the vector element type is illegal). The forms that take a double should only be used for simple constants that can be exactly represented in VT. No checks are made.

### ComputeNumSignBits() {#ac01c66c983bfbac05a0cf903f08417df}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>unsigned SelectionDAG::ComputeNumSignBits (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> Op, unsigned Depth=0) const</>}>
Return the number of times the sign bit of the register is replicated into the other bits.

We know that at least 1 bit is always equal to the sign bit (itself), but other cases can give us information. For example, immediately after an &quot;SRA X, 2&quot;, we know that the top 3 bits are all equal to each other, so we return 3. Targets can implement the ComputeNumSignBitsForTarget method in the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetlowering">TargetLowering</a> class to allow target nodes to be understood.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/selectiondag-h/#l02056">2056</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/selectiondag-h">SelectionDAG.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/selectiondag/selectiondag-cpp/#l04742">4742</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/selectiondag/selectiondag-cpp">SelectionDAG.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### ComputeNumSignBits() {#aa0007d0a081ae03902143cb1f001afbb}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>unsigned SelectionDAG::ComputeNumSignBits (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> Op, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> &amp; DemandedElts, unsigned Depth=0) const</>}>
Return the number of times the sign bit of the register is replicated into the other bits.

We know that at least 1 bit is always equal to the sign bit (itself), but other cases can give us information. For example, immediately after an &quot;SRA X, 2&quot;, we know that the top 3 bits are all equal to each other, so we return 3. The DemandedElts argument allows us to only collect the minimum sign bits of the requested vector elements. Targets can implement the ComputeNumSignBitsForTarget method in the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetlowering">TargetLowering</a> class to allow target nodes to be understood.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/selectiondag-h/#l02066">2066</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/selectiondag-h">SelectionDAG.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/selectiondag/selectiondag-cpp/#l04754">4754</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/selectiondag/selectiondag-cpp">SelectionDAG.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

Loads are not normal binary operators: their result type is not determined by their operands, and they produce a value AND a token chain.

This function will set the MOLoad flag on MMOFlags, but you can set it if you want. The MOStore flag must not be set.

### getMachineNode() {#a1c04c72abd24de2572a03ef686a36dd6}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>MachineSDNode &#42; SelectionDAG::getMachineNode (unsigned Opcode, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdloc">SDLoc</a> &amp; dl, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/evt">EVT</a> VT)</>}>
These are used for target selectors to create a new node with specified return type(s), <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstr">MachineInstr</a> opcode, and operands.

getMachineNode - These are used for target selectors to create a new node with specified return type(s), <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstr">MachineInstr</a> opcode, and operands.

Note that getMachineNode returns the resultant node. If there is already a node of the specified opcode and operands, it returns that node instead of the current one.

### isSplatValue() {#a5f4d7e1483110d8b2220f79f3ee536d6}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool SelectionDAG::isSplatValue (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> V, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> &amp; DemandedElts, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> &amp; UndefElts, unsigned Depth=0) const</>}>
Test whether <code>V</code> has a splatted value for all the demanded elements.

isSplatValue - Return true if the vector V has the same value across all DemandedElts.

On success <code>UndefElts</code> will indicate the elements that have UNDEF values instead of the splat value, this is only guaranteed to be correct for <code>DemandedElts</code>.

NOTE: The function will return true for a demanded splat of UNDEF values.

For scalable vectors, we don&#39;t know the number of lanes at compile time. Instead, we use a 1 bit <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> to represent a conservative value for all lanes; that is, that one bit value is implicitly splatted across all lanes.

### Legalize() {#a6f1e49f6f347835aa6b5a7423dd364d1}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="void SelectionDAG::Legalize ()">
This transforms the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/selectiondag">SelectionDAG</a> into a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/selectiondag">SelectionDAG</a> that is compatible with the target instruction selector, as indicated by the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetlowering">TargetLowering</a> object.

This is the entry point for the file.

### LegalizeOp() {#a74ce53f838a5372200a8e8ec9b135316}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool SelectionDAG::LegalizeOp (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdnode">SDNode</a> &#42; N, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallsetvector">SmallSetVector</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdnode">SDNode</a> &#42;, 16 &gt; &amp; UpdatedNodes)</>}>
Transforms a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/selectiondag">SelectionDAG</a> node and any operands to it into a node that is compatible with the target instruction selector, as indicated by the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetlowering">TargetLowering</a> object.

<SectionUser title="Returns">
true if <code>N</code> is a valid, legal node after calling this.
</SectionUser>

This essentially runs a single recursive walk of the <code>Legalize</code> process over the given node (and its operands). This can be used to incrementally legalize the DAG. All of the nodes which are directly replaced, potentially including N, are added to the output parameter <code>UpdatedNodes</code> so that the delta to the DAG can be understood by the caller.

When this returns false, N has been legalized in a way that make the pointer passed in no longer valid. It may have even been deleted from the DAG, and so it shouldn&#39;t be used further. When this returns true, the N passed in is a legal node, and can be immediately processed as such. This may still have done some work on the DAG, and will still populate UpdatedNodes with any new nodes replacing those originally in the DAG.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/selectiondag-h/#l00643">643</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/selectiondag-h">SelectionDAG.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/selectiondag/legalizedag-cpp/#l05857">5857</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/selectiondag/legalizedag-cpp">LegalizeDAG.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### LegalizeVectors() {#a1d9e10dce8ca4da8bad80838a6cf426b}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="bool SelectionDAG::LegalizeVectors ()">
This transforms the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/selectiondag">SelectionDAG</a> into a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/selectiondag">SelectionDAG</a> that only uses vector math operations supported by the target.

This is necessary as a separate step from Legalize because unrolling a vector operation can introduce illegal types, which requires running LegalizeTypes again.

This returns true if it made any changes; in that case, LegalizeTypes is called again before Legalize.

Note that this is an involved process that may invalidate pointers into the graph.

### makeStateFunctionCall() {#a88f0e5db31eb88103b548f1bcce2da58}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>SDValue SelectionDAG::makeStateFunctionCall (unsigned LibFunc, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> Ptr, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> InChain, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdloc">SDLoc</a> &amp; DLoc)</>}>
Helper used to make a call to a library function that has one argument of pointer type.

Such functions include &#39;fegetmode&#39;, &#39;fesetenv&#39; and some others, which are used to get or set floating-point state. They have one argument of pointer type, which points to the memory region containing bits of the floating-point state. The value returned by such function is ignored in the created call.


<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="<a href=&quot;/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a26a5e408fc09c5664d2bbb2d7fae154e&quot;>LibFunc</a>">Reference to library function (value of <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/rtlib/#a50a0bab21f1d14a86a1483ec283e4447">RTLIB::Libcall</a>).</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="Ptr">Pointer used to save/load state.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="InChain">Ingoing token chain.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

<SectionUser title="Returns">
Outgoing chain token.
</SectionUser>

### matchBinOpReduction() {#af6fb44d5b8fabbbd624ebe34231c5ce6}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>SDValue SelectionDAG::matchBinOpReduction (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdnode">SDNode</a> &#42; Extract, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110">ISD::NodeType</a> &amp; BinOp, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110">ISD::NodeType</a> &gt; CandidateBinOps, bool AllowPartials=false)</>}>
Match a binop + shuffle pyramid that represents a horizontal reduction over the elements of a vector starting from the EXTRACT&#95;VECTOR&#95;ELT node /p Extract.

The reduction must use one of the opcodes listed in /p CandidateBinOps and on success /p BinOp will contain the matching opcode. Returns the vector that is being reduced on, or <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64isellowering-cpp/#a51cb24bd3e700fcf2f93d1afbb555a16">SDValue()</a> if a reduction was not matched. If <code>AllowPartials</code> is set then in the case of a reduction pattern that only matches the first few stages, the extracted subvector of the start of the reduction is returned.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/selectiondag-h/#l02246">2246</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/selectiondag-h">SelectionDAG.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/selectiondag/selectiondag-cpp/#l12607">12607</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/selectiondag/selectiondag-cpp">SelectionDAG.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### MorphNodeTo() {#a5877bd47049087f890aed4f0f501ec3f}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>SDNode &#42; SelectionDAG::MorphNodeTo (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdnode">SDNode</a> &#42; N, unsigned Opc, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/sdvtlist">SDVTList</a> VTs, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> &gt; Ops)</>}>
This <em>mutates</em> the specified node to have the specified return type, opcode, and operands.

MorphNodeTo - This <em>mutates</em> the specified node to have the specified return type, opcode, and operands.

Note that MorphNodeTo returns the resultant node. If there is already a node of the specified opcode and operands, it returns that node instead of the current one. Note that the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdloc">SDLoc</a> need not be the same.

Using MorphNodeTo is faster than creating a new node and swapping it in with ReplaceAllUsesWith both because it often avoids allocating a new node, and because it doesn&#39;t require CSE recalculation for any of the node&#39;s users.

However, note that MorphNodeTo recursively deletes dead nodes from the DAG. As a consequence it isn&#39;t appropriate to use from within the DAG combiner or the legalizer which maintain worklists that would need to be updated when deleting things.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/selectiondag-h/#l01693">1693</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/selectiondag-h">SelectionDAG.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/selectiondag/selectiondag-cpp/#l11051">11051</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/selectiondag/selectiondag-cpp">SelectionDAG.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### ReplaceAllUsesWith() {#a8518c120f782df9e974c8b1b589feb40}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void SelectionDAG::ReplaceAllUsesWith (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> FromN, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> To)</>}>
Modify anything using &#39;From&#39; to use &#39;To&#39; instead.

ReplaceAllUsesWith - Modify anything using &#39;From&#39; to use &#39;To&#39; instead.

This can cause recursive merging of nodes in the DAG. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/use">Use</a> the first version if &#39;From&#39; is known to have a single result, use the second if you have two nodes with identical results (or if &#39;To&#39; has a superset of the results of &#39;From&#39;), use the third otherwise.

These methods all take an optional UpdateListener, which (if not null) is informed about nodes that are deleted and modified due to recursive changes in the dag.

These functions only replace all existing uses. It&#39;s possible that as these replacements are being performed, CSE may cause the From node to be given new uses. These new uses of From are left in place, and not automatically transferred to To.

This can cause recursive merging of nodes in the DAG.

This version assumes From has a single result value.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/selectiondag-h/#l01817">1817</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/selectiondag-h">SelectionDAG.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/selectiondag/selectiondag-cpp/#l11656">11656</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/selectiondag/selectiondag-cpp">SelectionDAG.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### UnrollVectorOp() {#a305a3a4874c597243cd5ba04af01339e}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>SDValue SelectionDAG::UnrollVectorOp (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdnode">SDNode</a> &#42; N, unsigned ResNE=0)</>}>
Utility function used by legalize and lowering to &quot;unroll&quot; a vector operation by splitting out the scalars and operating on each element individually.

If the ResNE is 0, fully unroll the vector op. If ResNE is less than the width of the vector op, unroll up to ResNE. If the ResNE is greater than the width of the vector op, unroll the vector op and fill the end of the resulting vector with UNDEFS.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/selectiondag-h/#l02256">2256</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/selectiondag-h">SelectionDAG.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/selectiondag/selectiondag-cpp/#l12723">12723</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/selectiondag/selectiondag-cpp">SelectionDAG.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### UpdateNodeOperands() {#ae8c041f67463ea67d6c43867729b82cb}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>SDNode &#42; SelectionDAG::UpdateNodeOperands (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdnode">SDNode</a> &#42; N, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> Op)</>}>
<em>Mutate</em> the specified node in-place to have the specified operands.

UpdateNodeOperands - <em>Mutate</em> the specified node in-place to have the specified operands.

If the resultant node already exists in the DAG, this does not modify the specified node, instead it returns the node that already exists. If the resultant node does not exist in the DAG, the input node is returned. As a degenerate case, if you specify the same input operands as the node already has, the input node is returned.

When true, additional steps are taken to ensure that <a href="#a7d26e2f2179b5a8a53381f8046e9d117">getConstant()</a> and similar functions return DAG nodes that have legal types.

This is important after type legalization since any illegally typed nodes generated after this point will not experience type legalization.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/selectiondag-h/#l00397">397</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/selectiondag-h">SelectionDAG.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>

  prototype={<>static uint16&#95;t llvm::SelectionDAG::getSyntheticNodeSubclassData (unsigned IROrder, ArgTypes &amp;&amp;... Args)</>}
  labels = {["inline", "static"]}>
Build a synthetic SDNodeT with the given args and extract its subclass data as an integer (e.g.

for use in a folding set).

The args to this function are the same as the args to SDNodeT&#39;s constructor, except the second arg (assumed to be a const <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/debugloc">DebugLoc</a>&amp;) is omitted.
